member.name: M:Artemis.Model.Square.Parse(System.String)
member.summary:
Creates a square object from the string representation.
A square string representation consists of two characters, with the first being an uppercase or lowercase file, and the second being the numerical rank. For example: a1, A1, f8, c3 are all valid squares. These, however: 4a, 7B, A9, j6 are not.
member.exception: When an invalid format for the square is given.

member.name: M:Artemis.Model.Square.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Checks if the given object is equal to this instance.
member.param: The object to check for equality.
member.returns: True if the given object is equal to the current object.

member.summary: Gets a list of all the sequences of squares in horizontal or vertical direction.

member.summary: Gets a list of all the sequences of squares along the same diagonal on light squares.

member.name: P:Artemis.Sequences.Sequence.DarkSquaredDiagonalSequences
member.summary: Gets a list of all the sequences of squares along the same diagonal on dark squares.

member.name: P:Artemis.Sequences.Sequence.DiagonalSequences
member.summary: Gets a list of all the sequences of squares along the same diagonal on either color square.

member.name: P:Artemis.Sequences.Sequence.AllSequences
member.summary: Gets a combination of all the sequences.

member.name: M:Artemis.Sequences.Sequence.FromRange(System.String)
member.summary:
Gets the sequence on the board based on the given range.
The expected format of the range string is firstSquare:lastSquare, where firstSquare and lastSquare are on the same rank, file, or diagonal.
For example:
Sequence.FromRange("a1:a8")
produces a range along the A-file consisting of the squares a1, a2, a3, a4, a5, a6, a7, a8.
member.exception: Thrown when the input range string is not in the required format.
Thrown when the input range given is not along the same rank, file, or diagonal.

member.name: M:Artemis.Sequences.Sequence.FromRange(Artemis.Model.Square,Artemis.Model.Square)
member.summary: Creates a sequence from a start square object and an end square object.
member.exception: If the two squares are not on the same rank, file, or diagonal.

member.name: T:Artemis.Sequences.SequenceDirection
member.summary: What direction the sequence is in.

member.name: F:Artemis.Sequences.SequenceDirection.Rank
member.summary: Indicates all positions in the sequence are along the same rank.

member.name: F:Artemis.Sequences.SequenceDirection.File
member.summary: Indicates all positions in the sequence are along the same file.

member.name: F:Artemis.Sequences.SequenceDirection.LightSquaredDiagonal
member.summary: Indicates all positions in the sequence are along the same diagonal on light squares.

member.name: F:Artemis.Sequences.SequenceDirection.DarkSquaredDiagonal
member.summary: Indicates all positions in the sequence are along the same diagonal on dark squares.

member.name: T:Artemis.Sequences.SequenceExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods for the core type.

member.name: M:Artemis.Sequences.SequenceExtensions.Slice``1(Artemis.Sequences.Sequence{``0},System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new sequence based on a portion of the original sequence.
member.param: The slice to take from the original sequence and put in the new sequence. The format of the slice is the same format that Python uses for its list slices. For the full details, see , or read the related Python Documentation.
member.typeparam: The type of values that the original sequence and subsequence contain.
member.returns: The subsequence resulting from the slice operation performed on the original sequence.

member.name: M:Artemis.Sequences.SequenceExtensions.Slice``1(Artemis.Sequences.Sequence{``0},Artemis.Sequences.SliceDescriptor)
member.summary: Creates a new sequence based on a portion of the original sequence.
member.param: A parsed description of the slice start index, end index, and step parameters.
member.typeparam: The type of values that the original sequence and subsequence contain.
member.returns: The subsequence resulting from the slice operation performed on the original sequence.

member.name: T:Artemis.Sequences.SequenceUtils
member.summary: Provides utility methods and extension methods for precomputed sequences, such as getting all the squares on a particular row.

member.name: M:Artemis.Sequences.SequenceUtils.CreateRankSequences
member.summary: Creates the sequences of squares on a chess board that share the same rank (the rows of the board).
member.returns: An immutable list of these sequences.

member.name: M:Artemis.Sequences.SequenceUtils.CreateFileSequences
member.summary: Creates the sequences of squares on a chess board that share the same file (the columns of the board).
member.returns: An immutable list of these sequences.

member.name: M:Artemis.Sequences.SequenceUtils.CreateDiagonalSequences
member.summary: Creates the sequences of squares on a chess board that are along the same diagonal.
member.returns: An immutable list of these sequences.

member.name: T:Artemis.Sequences.SliceDescriptor
member.summary:
A parsed description of a slice to take.
This is parsed from the slice string input. The input string format follows the slice string format used by Python. It can take the form of any of these formats:
start:stop[:step]
start:[:step]
:stop[:step]
In other words, one colon is always required to separate the start and stop indices. The start and stop indices are both optional - omitting them defaults the start index to 0, and the end index to the length of the original sequence. For example: :5 is syntactically identical to: 0:5 Both would generate a slice starting at the beginning of the original sequence, and ending at the fifth element in the sequence.
The start index can also be negative. For example: -4:-2 would produce a new sequence starting from the fourth-to-last element in the original sequence, and ending right before the second-to-last element in the original sequence.
Omitting the end index is probably the most useful slice format to use, since it will default to the end of the original sequence. For example: 5: creates a slice that skips the first five values in the original sequence, but then contains all the remaining values. If the original slice has 10 elements, then the example above would product the same slice as this alternative: 5:10
Omitting both the start and the end values creates a slice identical to the original sequence: :
The parameter is always optional - the trailing colon isn't required, and when omitted, either implicitly (with a simple start:stop), or explicitly (start:stop:), it defaults to 1.
If the step parameter is included and set to a value other than 1, it changes the number of items to advance to in each iteration of the sequence. If a sequence contains 10 elements, and the slice 2:10:2 is used, the resulting sequence will consist of items with the following indices in the original sequence:
2, 4, 6, 8
The most practical application of this is to run a sequence in reverse. By setting the step parameter to -1, the sequence is ran backwards. For example: -3::-1 produces a subsequence containing everything from the original sequence except the last two elements, but reversed.

member.name: M:Artemis.Sequences.SliceDescriptor.#ctor(System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct.
member.param: The start index for the slice.
The end index for the slice.

member.name: P:Artemis.Sequences.SliceDescriptor.Start
member.summary: Gets the start index of the slice. If not present, the slice will start at the beginning.

member.name: P:Artemis.Sequences.SliceDescriptor.Stop
member.summary: Gets the stop index of the slice. If not present, the slice will stop at the end.

member.name: P:Artemis.Sequences.SliceDescriptor.Step
member.summary: Gets the step of the slice. If not present, the step defaults to 1.

member.name: M:Artemis.Sequences.SliceDescriptor.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Parse the string representation of a slice into a slice description that can be used for slice generation.

member.name: M:Artemis.Sequences.SliceDescriptor.ValidateDescriptor(System.String)
member.summary: Determines if a given slice string is properly formatted.
member.exception: When the provided slice descriptor string is not properly formatted.

member.name: M:Artemis.Sequences.SliceDescriptor.ToEffectiveDescriptor``1(Artemis.Sequences.Sequence{``0})
member.summary: Converts a descriptor with potentially omitted parameter to one with set, non-null parameters resolved relative to the original sequence. The index selection behavior is copied directly from the original Python source to ensure exactness.
member.typeparam: The type of values in the sequence.
member.returns: The effective descriptor that will directly be used for creating the slice.

member.name: T:Artemis.Sequences.EffectiveSliceDescriptor
member.summary: An internal class representing the actual start index, stop index, and step parameters after omissions are patched with default values.
